meanings.definition: The action of changing the position or order of things.
meanings.sent1: The rearrangement of the furniture in the room made it feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: She made a quick rearrangement of the books on the shelf to find her favorite novel.
meanings.sent3: The rearrangement of the seating plan at the party caused some confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The rearrangement of priorities in his life brought him a sense of clarity and purpose.
meanings.sent5: The rearrangement of the puzzle pieces revealed the hidden picture.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or adjusting something in a different way.
meanings.sent1: After the rearrangement of the schedule, we had more time for breaks during the day.
meanings.sent2: The rearrangement of the ingredients in the recipe made it taste even better.
meanings.sent3: The rearrangement of the plants in the garden created a more harmonious look.
meanings.sent4: Her rearrangement of the paragraphs in the essay improved the flow of the writing.
meanings.sent5: The rearrangement of the colors in the painting added depth and contrast.
